data.title: Andrew Huxley
data.meta_description: Sold for $245 | Physiologist and biophysicist who won the 1963 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine (1917–2012). AMS, one page both sides, 8 x 10,
data.text:
Physiologist and biophysicist who won the 1963 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine (1917–2012). AMS, one page both sides, 8 x 10, no date. Handwritten manuscript for an article on cardiac muscle headed “After p. 15” and signed “Andrew Huxley” at the top, in part: “The nature of the connection between these tubules and the surface membrane was another question that caused a great deal of difficulty…The fact that the tubules are open to the extracellular space was demonstrated in 1963 by several sets of experiments in different laboratories.” In fine condition. Accompanied by an offprint of a different article and biographical sheet. Pre-certified PSA/DNA.

Auction Info
